main event: An unidentified flying object was observed at Pepperell AFB in Newfoundland on 15 December 1957.
interesting points: The object was egg-shaped and red, and it was observed both visually and by radar., It was stationary but moved 1.5 nautical miles in 5 minutes., The object caused confusion as it did not appear on film taken during the sighting., Winds from the WNW might have affected the object's movement., Two reliable witnesses reported the sighting, and conditions were clear with unlimited visibility.
witness description: A/3C Dougherty, Michael P. and S/SGT Frounfeker, Robert
